intro: Stenogyne elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic properties. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are elliptical in shape and have a slightly hairy texture. Stenogyne elliptica is often found growing in moist, shaded areas of Hawaiian forests.
